Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.145)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87660) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87660)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 180 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
